availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Perry (Henry County, Kentucky, merchant and justice of the peace)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, merchant and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Caroline B. Lee Perry. Father of Louis W. Perry, Fannie W. Perry, Denora Perry, Caroline Perry, Mary E. Perry, Flora A. Perry, and John C. Perry. Merchant in Henry County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Henry County in 1863.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry, New Castle, p. 6. Find A Grave, "William A. Perry (October 9, 1814-June 19, 1897)," Memorial #23047744, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23047744 (accessed April 9, 2018). KYR-0001-004-0198.
